de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcore.rest

Class RestInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcore.rest.RestInterface

  • @Path(value="interface/v2")
public class RestInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the REST interface of the JEngine core. The core module provides methods to execute PCM instances and to access the date inside the engine. This REST interface provides methods to access this information and to control the instances. Methods which are necessary for the controlling can be found inside the ExecutionService. This class will use Connection to access the database directly.

    • Method Detail

      • getScenarios

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getScenarios(@Context
                                                       javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                       @QueryParam(value="filter")
                                                       java.lang.String filterString)
        This method allows to give an overview of all scenarios. The response will return a JSON-Array containing the basic information of all scenarios currently inside the database. If different versions of an scenarios exist only the latest ones will be added to the json.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - Specifies the context. For example the uri of the request.
        filterString - Specifies a search. Only scenarios which name contain the specified string will be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns a JSON-Object with an Array with entries for every Scenario. Each Entry is a JSON-Object with a label and id of a scenario.

      • getScenario

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getScenario(@Context
                                                      javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uri,
                                                      @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                      int scenarioID)
        This method provides information about one scenario. The scenario is specified by an given id. The response of this request will contain a valid JSON-Object containing detailed information about the scenario. If there is no scenario with the specific id a 404 will be returned, with a meaningful error message.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The Id of the scenario used inside the database.
        Returns:
        Returns a JSON-Object with detailed information about one scenario. The Information contain the id, label, number of instances, latest version and more.

      • getAllEmailTasks

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/emailtask")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getAllEmailTasks(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                           int scenarioID,
                                                           @QueryParam(value="filter")
                                                           java.lang.String filterString)
        This method provides information about all email Tasks inside a given scenario. The information consists of the id and the label. A Json Object will be returned with an array of ids and a Map from ids to labels.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The ID of the scenario, its mail tasks will be returned.
        filterString - A Filter String, only mail tasks with a label containing this filter String will be returned.
        Returns:
        The JSON Object with ids and labels.

      • getEmailTaskConfiguration

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/emailtask/{emailTaskID}")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getEmailTaskConfiguration(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                    int scenarioID,
                                                                    @PathParam(value="emailTaskID")
                                                                    int mailTaskID)
        This method provides information about an email Task. It will return a JSON-Object with information about the mail configuration. A Configuration contains a receiver, a subject and a content. A Mail task is specified by:
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The ID of the scenario model.
        mailTaskID - The control node ID of the mail Task.
        Returns:
        Returns a 404 if the mail Task or scenario does not exist and a 200 (OK) with a JSON-Object if the emailTask was found.

      • getScenarioInstances

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getScenarioInstances(@Context
                                                               javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uri,
                                                               @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                               int scenarioID,
                                                               @QueryParam(value="filter")
                                                               java.lang.String filterString)
        This method provides information about all instances of one scenario. The scenario is specified by an given id. If there is no scenario with the specific id a 404 response with a meaningful error message will be returned. If the Scenario exists a JSON-Array containing JSON-Objects with important information about an instance of the scenario will be returned.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The id of the scenario which instances should be returned.
        filterString - Specifies a search. Only scenarios which name contain the specified string will be returned.
        Returns:
        A JSON-Object with an array of information about all instances of one specified scenario. The information contains the id and name.

      • getTerminationCondition

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioId}/terminationcondition")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTerminationCondition(@PathParam(value="scenarioId")
                                                                  int scenarioID)
        This method provides information about the termination condition. Of the specified Scenario. The termination condition is a set of sets of conditions. Only if all conditions of one set are true the scenario will terminate. If the scenario does not exists a 404 with an error will be returned. If the scenario exists the JSON representation of the condition set will be returned.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - This id specifies the scenario. The id is the primary key inside the database.
        Returns:
        Returns a response object. It will either be a 200 or 404. The content will be either the JSON representation of the termination condition or an JSON object with the error message.

      • startNewInstance

        @POST
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance")
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response startNewInstance(@Context
                                                                     javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uri,
                                                                     @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                     int scenarioID)
        Creates a new instance of a specified scenario. This method assumes that the name of then new instance will be the same as the name of the scenario. Hence no additional information should be transmitted. The response will imply if the post was successful.
        Parameters:
        uri - a context, which holds information about the server
        scenarioID - the id of the scenario.
        Returns:
        The Response of the POST. The Response code will be either a 201 (CREATED) if the post was successful or 400 (BAD_REQUEST) if the scenarioID was invalid. The content of the Response will be a JSON-Object containing information about the new instance.

      • startNewNamedInstance

        @PUT
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance")
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response startNewNamedInstance(@Context
                                                                         javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                                         @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                         int scenarioID,
                                                                         RestInterface.NamedJaxBean name)
        Creates a new instance of a specified scenario. This method assumes that the new instance will be named. The name will be received as a JSON-Object inside the request Body. The JSON should have the format {"name": <nameOfInstance>}. The response will imply if the post was successful.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - The context of the server, used to receive the url.
        scenarioID - the id of the scenario.
        name - The name, which will be used for the new instance.
        Returns:
        The Response of the PUT. The Response code will be either a 201 (CREATED) if the post was successful or 400 (BAD_REQUEST) if the scenarioID was invalid. The content of the Response will be a JSON-Object containing information about the new instance.

      • terminateScenarioInstance

        @PUT
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}")
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response terminateScenarioInstance(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                             int scenarioID,
                                                                             @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                                             int instanceID)
        This post can be used to terminate an existing scenario instance. The scenario instance is specified by an instance id and a scenario id. The Response will be either a JSON Object with an error message (400) or an 201 without an content.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The Id of the scenario.
        instanceID - The Id of the instance to be terminated.
        Returns:
        A Response object with json Object. A Created Response will be returned if the POST has been successful and a BAD_REQUEST else.

      • getScenarioInstance

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getScenarioInstance(@Context
                                                              javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                              @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                              int scenarioID,
                                                              @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                              int instanceID)
        This method provides detailed information about a scenario instance. The information will contain the id, name, parent scenario and the number of activities in the different states. The Response is JSON-Object.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - Contains the context information, is used to build links to other resources.
        scenarioID - The ID of the scenario.
        instanceID - The ID of the instance.
        Returns:
        Will return a Response with a JSON-Object body, containing the information about the instance. If the instance ID or both are incorrect 404 (NOT_FOUND) will be returned. If the scenario ID is wrong but the instance ID is correct a 301 (REDIRECT) will be returned. If both IDs are correct a 200 (OK) with the expected JSON-Content will be returned.

      • getActivitiesOfInstance

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getActivitiesOfInstance(@Context
                                                                  javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                                  @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                  int scenarioID,
                                                                  @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                                  int instanceID,
                                                                  @QueryParam(value="filter")
                                                                  java.lang.String filterString,
                                                                  @QueryParam(value="state")
                                                                  java.lang.String state)
        Returns a JSON-Object containing information about all activity instances of a specified scenario instance. The JSON-Object will group the activities regarding their state. If the scenario instance does not exist, the response code will specify the error which occurred.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - The context object. It provides information the server context.
        scenarioID - The id of the scenario
        instanceID - The id of the instance.
        filterString - Defines a search strings. Only activities with a label containing this String will be shown.
        Returns:
        A Response with the status and content of the request. A 200 (OK) implies that the instance was found and the result contains the JSON-Object. If only the scenario ID is incorrect a 301 (REDIRECT) will point to the correct URL. If the instance ID is incorrect a 404 (NOT_FOUND) will be returned.

      • getActivity

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity/{activityID}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getActivity(@Context
                                             javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                             @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                             int scenarioID,
                                             @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                             int scenarioInstanceID,
                                             @PathParam(value="activityID")
                                             int activityID)
        This method is used to get all the information for an activity. This means the label, id and a link for the input-/outputSets.
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - A UriInfo object, which holds the server context.
        scenarioID - The databaseID of a scenario.
        scenarioInstanceID - The databaseID of a scenarioInstance.
        activityID - The databaseID of an activityInstance.
        Returns:
        a response Object with the status code: 200 if everything was correct and holds the information about the activityInstance. A 404 Not Found is returned if the scenario/scenarioInstance/activityInstanceID is wrong.

@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity/{activityID}/references")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getReferencesForActivity(@Context

        Parameters:
        uriInfo - A UriInfo object, which holds the server context.
        scenarioID - The databaseID of a scenario.
        scenarioInstanceID - The databaseID of a scenarioInstance.
        activityID - The databaseID of an activityInstance.
        Returns:
        a json object containing the referenced activities

      • getInputDataObjects

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity/{activityID}/input")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getInputDataObjects(@Context
                                                     javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                     @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                     int scenarioID,
                                                     @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                     int scenarioInstanceID,
                                                     @PathParam(value="activityID")
                                                     int activityID)
        This method responds to a GET request by returning an array of inputSets. Each contains the inputSetDatabaseID, the name of the dataObject and their state as a Map & a link to get the dataObjectInstances with their dataAttributesInstances. The result is determined by:
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - A UriInfo object, which holds the server context used for the link.
        scenarioID - The databaseID of the scenario.
        scenarioInstanceID - The databaseID of the scenarioInstance belonging to the aforementioned scenario.
        activityID - The databaseID of the activityInstance belonging to this scenarioInstance.
        Returns:
        a response consisting of: array of inputSets containing the inputSetDatabaseID, the name of the dataObject and their state as a Map & a link to get the dataObjectInstances with their dataAttributesInstances. a response status code: A 200 if everything was correct. A 404 Not Found is returned if the scenario/scenarioInstance/activityInstance is non-existing or if the activity has no inputSet & with an error message instead of the array.

      • getOutputDataObjects

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity/{activityID}/output")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getOutputDataObjects(@Context
                                                      javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                      @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                      int scenarioID,
                                                      @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                      int scenarioInstanceID,
                                                      @PathParam(value="activityID")
                                                      int activityID)
        This method responds to a GET request by returning an array of outputSets. Each contains the outputSetDatabaseID, the name of the dataObject and their state as a Map & a link to get the dataObjectInstances with their dataAttributesInstances. The result is determined by:
        Parameters:
        uriInfo - A UriInfo object, which holds the server context used for the link.
        scenarioID - The databaseID of the scenario.
        scenarioInstanceID - The databaseID of the scenarioInstance belonging to the aforementioned scenario.
        activityID - The databaseID of the activityInstance belonging to this scenarioInstance.
        Returns:
        a response consisting of: array of outputSets containing the outputSetDatabaseID, the name of the dataObject and their state as a Map & a link to get the dataObjectInstances with their dataAttributesInstances. a response status code: A 200 if everything was correct. A 404 Not Found is returned if the scenario/scenarioInstance/activityInstance is non-existing or if the activity has no outputSet & with an error message instead of the array.

      • getInputDataObjectsAndAttributes

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/inputset/{inputsetID}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getInputDataObjectsAndAttributes(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                  int scenarioID,
                                                                  @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                                  int scenarioInstanceID,
                                                                  @PathParam(value="inputsetID")
                                                                  int inputsetID)
        This method responds to a GET request by returning an array of dataObjectsInstances with their dataAttributeInstances belonging to an inputSet. The outcome is specified by:
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - This is the databaseID of the scenario.
        scenarioInstanceID - This is the databaseID of the scenarioInstance of the aforementioned scenario.
        inputsetID - This is the databaseID of an inputSet belonging to this scenarioInstance.
        Returns:
        a response consisting of: an array of dataObjectsInstances with their dataAttributeInstances [also as an array]. a response status code: A 200 if everything is correct. A 404 Not Found is returned if the scenario/scenarioInstance/inputSetInstance is non-existing & with an error message instead of the array.

      • getOutputDataObjectsAndAttributes

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/outputset/{outputsetID}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getOutputDataObjectsAndAttributes(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                                   int scenarioID,
                                                                   @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                                   int scenarioInstanceID,
                                                                   @PathParam(value="outputsetID")
                                                                   int outputsetID)
        This method responds to a GET request by returning an array of dataObjectsInstances with their dataAttributeInstances belonging to an outputSet. The outcome is specified by:
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - This is the databaseID of the scenario.
        scenarioInstanceID - This is the databaseID of the scenarioInstance of the aforementioned scenario.
        outputsetID - This is the databaseID of an outputSet belonging to this scenarioInstance.
        Returns:
        a response consisting of: an array of dataObjectsInstances with their dataAttributeInstances also as an array. a response status code: A 200 if everything is correct. A 404 Not Found is returned if the scenario/scenarioInstance/outputSetInstance is non-existing with an error message instead of the array.

      • updateActivityState

        @POST
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity/{activityID}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateActivityState(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                      int scenarioID,
                                                      @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                      int scenarioInstanceID,
                                                      @PathParam(value="activityID")
                                                      int activityID,
                                                      @QueryParam(value="state")
                                                      java.lang.String state,
                                                      @DefaultValue(value="-1")@QueryParam(value="outputset")
                                                      int outputset)
        Updates the state of an activity instance. The state will be changed to the specified one. The activity Instance is specified by:
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The id of a scenario model.
        scenarioInstanceID - the id of an scenario instance.
        activityID - the control node id of the activity.
        state - the new state of the activity.
        Returns:
        Returns a Response, the response code implies the outcome of the PUT-Request. A 202 (ACCEPTED) means that the POST was successful. A 400 (BAD_REQUEST) if the transition was not allowed.

      • setDataAttribute

@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/activity/{activityID}")

        scenarioInstanceID - the id of an scenario instance.
        activityID - the control node id of the activity.
        Returns:

      • getDataObjects

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/dataobject")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getDataObjects(@Context
                                                         javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                         @PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                         int scenarioID,
                                                         @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                         int instanceID,
                                                         @QueryParam(value="filter")
                                                         java.lang.String filterString)
        Returns a JSON-Object, which contains information about all data objects of a specified scenario instance. The data contains the id, label and state.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The ID of the scenario model.
        instanceID - The ID of the scenario instance.
        filterString - A String which specifies a filter. Only Data Objects with a label containing this string will be returned.
        Returns:
        A Response with the outcome of the GET-Request. The Response will be a 200 (OK) if the specified instance was found. Hence the JSON-Object will be returned. It will be a 301 (REDIRECT) if the scenarioID is wrong. And a 404 if the instance id is wrong.

      • getDataObject

        @GET
@Path(value="scenario/{scenarioID}/instance/{instanceID}/dataobject/{dataObjectID}")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getDataObject(@PathParam(value="scenarioID")
                                                        int scenarioID,
                                                        @PathParam(value="instanceID")
                                                        int instanceID,
                                                        @PathParam(value="dataObjectID")
                                                        int dataObjectID)
        This method provides detailed information about an data Object. The information contain the id, parent scenario instance, label and the current state, This information will be provided as a JSON-Object. A Data object is specified by:
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The scenario Model ID.
        instanceID - The scenario Instance ID.
        dataObjectID - The Data Object ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a JSON-Object with information about the dataObject, the response code will be a 200 (OK). If the data object does not exist a 404 (NOT_FOUND) will not be returned. If the instance does exist but some params are wrong a 301 (REDIRECT) will be returned.
